summary: The International Nuclear Energy Act of 2025 aims to foster U.S. leadership in civil nuclear energy cooperation and exports. It establishes a White House office for coordination, a Nuclear Exports Working Group, and initiatives to support the adoption of U.S. nuclear technologies by other nations. The bill addresses financing, cooperation with allies, and seeks to streamline regulatory processes. It also amends existing legislation to promote U.S. nuclear energy companies and authorizes appropriations for various programs.
